title: Best food events around Boston and New England for fall 2025
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Big E in West Springfield offers diverse state fair foods, including fried Oreos, cheese curds, and regional specialties.
What the Fluff? Festival in Somerville celebrates Marshmallow Fluff with games, music, and themed food on September 20.
Wellfleet OysterFest features raw bars and seafood dishes, along with culinary demonstrations and family activities on October 18-19.

title: Emmy nominee Jeff Hiller joins the latest episode of the Love Letters podcast
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Jeff Hiller, Emmy nominee for 'Somebody Somewhere', shares a breakup story on the Love Letters podcast.
Hiller's tale includes life lessons from his 20s and a relationship with a man who mistreated him.
The episode discusses iconic romantic speeches from films like 'When Harry Met Sally' and 'Notting Hill'.

title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, pleaded not guilty to charges of murder and kidnapping in Lynn District Court, involving his sister.
Michelle Knox, 38, was found dead after police responded to an apartment on Newhall Street in Lynn.
The case has been impounded by the judge, keeping records unavailable to the public, according to Essex County DA.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks and four QB hits in the 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
New England invested heavily in defense with offseason signings including Harold Landry and Milton Williams.
Despite strong pass rush from Landry, the Patriots allowed 362 passing yards and nine plays over 20 yards.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews highlighted the Patriots' disappointing run game in their 20-13 season-opening loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots, expected to focus on the run, gained only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts against Las Vegas.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw 46 passes, reflecting the team's struggle and tactical shift away from the ground game.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm prepares to lead his first Bruins training camp, emphasizing intensity and accountability in Hanover, Mass.
The Bruins aim to improve after a 33-39-10 season; Sturm plans to instill new systems and principles.
Sturm focuses on communication, directness, and improving both defense and power play for team's success.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert is on trial for the 2017 kidnapping and assault of a Worcester girl, now 15, allegedly throwing her off a bridge.
The girl, who testified in court, was allegedly kidnapped from her grandparents' Worcester home and thrown into Lake Quinsigamond.
Hubert has pleaded not guilty to charges including attempted murder, while the trial has been delayed since 2020.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye defends his role in Patriots' offense despite a challenging loss to the Raiders with 287 yards and one interception.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel considers re-evaluating the complexity of Josh McDaniels' offense following Maye's struggles in their season opener.
Maye comments on Bill Belichick's ban of Patriots scouts at UNC, calling it unfortunate but supporting his former team.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell struggled in his debut, committing two false start penalties and being involved in two sacks.
Veteran tackle Morgan Moses offered encouragement, noting first games are often challenging as rookies adapt to surprises in play.
Patriots scored 13 points in the opener, continuing offensive struggles from last season under coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte was once a top NFL prospect likened to Stefon Diggs before being drafted sixth round by the Patriots.
An ankle injury and surgeries at LSU led to Boutte's decreased college performance, affecting his NFL draft position.
Boutte excelled in Patriots' preseason, now a key receiver, showcasing skills and quarterback trust during the season opener.
